title: American Anisimova lands in Wimbledon quarters
description: No. 13 Amanda Anisimova, one of two American women remaining in the Wimbledon draw, defeated No. 30 Linda Noskova in three sets Sunday night to reach the quarterfinals.

title: Alcaraz survives Rublev test, rolls on at Wimbledon
description: No. 2 Carlos Alcaraz rebounded from an early scare Sunday against No. 14 Andrey Rublev to emerge with a 6-7 (5), 6-3, 6-4, 6-4 victory and spot in the Wimbledon quarterfinals.

title: Unlock the Perfect Slice Serve - Essential Tennis Podcast #415
description: The wide slice serve is a CRITICAL tool to have in your tool box. It pulls opponents out of position, opens the court up for you to hit into, exposes their usually weaker backhand side, and forces them to run twice as far for the next shot - if they even get it at all. Let’s take a deep dive into how YOU can develop this powerful weapon, step by step in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Djokovic Secrets To Winning More Matches - Essential Tennis Podcast #414
description: In this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, you're going to learn the top 3 tactical secrets of Novak Djokovic that you can apply in your very next match. Use these tools to gain precision, consistency, and offense to make your opponents more uncomfortable, win more points, and win more matches.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: What is the Wimbledon tennis schedule?
description: The No. 1 player in the PIF ATP Rankings Jannik Sinner and seven-time champion Novak Djokovic will play their fourth-round matches at Wimbledon on Monday. View the day's featured matches below and the full order of play here. Centre Court (starts 1:30 p.m.)  [11] Alex de Minaur (AUS) vs. [6] Novak Djokovic (SRB) [7] Mirra Andreeva vs. [10] Emma Navarro (USA) [1] Jannik Sinner vs. [19] Grigor Dimitrov (BUL) No. 1 Court (starts 1 p.m.) [19] Ekaterina Alexandrova vs. Belinda Bencic (SUI) [10] Ben Shelton (USA) vs. Lorenzo Sonego (ITA) [8] Iga Swiatek (POL) vs. [23] Clara Tauson (DEN) Read More from Wimbledon: Pump it up: Djokovic’s daughter Tara steals Wimbledon show with celebration dance 'Pain-free' Dimitrov ready for Sinner clash following retirement nightmare How Shelton hilariously earned his sister a week off of work [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: What were the Wimbledon results?
description: Carlos Alcaraz continued his Wimbledon title defence on Sunday with a fourth-round victory against Andrey Rublev, while Taylor Fritz and Cameron Norrie also advanced. View Sunday's featured results from the All England Club below and click here to see all scores. Centre Court Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova def. Sonay Kartal (GBR) 7-6(3), 6-4 [1] Aryna Sabalenka def. [24] Elise Mertens (BEL) 6-4, 7-6(4) [2] Carlos Alcaraz (ESP) def. Andrey Rublev 6-7(5), 6-3, 6-4, 6-4 No. 1 Court [5] Taylor Fritz (USA) def. Jordan Thompson (AUS) 6-1, 3-0 ret. Cameron Norrie (GBR) def. [Q] Nicolas Jarry (CHI) 6-3, 7-6(4), 6-7(7), 6-7(5), 6-3 [13] Amanda Anisimova (USA) def. title: 'A well-deserved fall' - Norrie's relief at Wimbledon win
description: Cameron Norrie is the final Briton standing in the Wimbledon singles after beating Chile's Nicolas Jarry to reach the men's quarter-finals.

title: Choose from all 18 courts on BBC iPlayer (UK only)
description: The triumphs, upsets and fightbacks from the world’s greatest tennis tournament.

title: Wimbledon 2025 Day Seven Recap
description: The first day of fourth-round action at Wimbledon 2025 saw Cameron Norrie delivered a gutsy five-set win over qualifier Nicolas Jarry in the match of the day, keeping British hopes alive under the closed roof of No. 1 Court. Carlos Alcaraz overcame a slow start to dispatch Andrey Rublev, while Taylor Fritz and Karen Khachanov …
author: Jonathan

title: Wimbledon 2025 Day Six Recap
description: With the third round wrapping up, Day Six at Wimbledon saw the top contenders make powerful statements as the tournament heads into the business end. Rain made a brief return to SW19, suspending play on the outside courts around 11:50 a.m. and delaying the schedule until just after 1:30 p.m. BST. But once the action …
author: Jonathan
